page.title: 18ACTIVITIES - VILLAGE
page.content: The{Hurstbourne Tarrant and District {Horticultural Society}was founded in 1930 to organise an annual Flower Show. In 1933 it made a profit of Â£50 and it was held successfully for many years in the meadow behind the school. The expense of hiring a marquee,and staging a large outdoor event became prohibitive, and the tradition lapsed. During this period the{Whist Club}was formed to provide continuity for the group, and to help raise funds to restart the Society. In 1985 this is being achieved, a Flower Vegetable and Produce Show will be held for the first time as an indoor event, in the aisle barn at Ibthorpe Manor Farm in September. The{Mother's Union}meets monthly but not in August. It holds open meetings for about 15 members. It is affiliated to groups in Britain and abroad.
